monogr.title: The vvorks of Ioseph Hall Doctor in Diuinitie, and Deane of Worcester : With a table newly added to the whole worke
monogr.author: Hall, Joseph

div.head: TO THE RIGHT HONOVRABLE WILLIAM EARLE OF PEMBROKE, LORD high Chamberlaine; CHANCELLOR of the Vniuersity of Oxford; One of his MAIESTIES most Honourable Priuy Counsell.
div.p: LEt it please you to receiue from the Presse what you vouchsafed to require from my pen: Ʋnworthy I confesse either of the publike light, or the beames of your Honours iudicious eies; yet such as (besides the motiue of common importunity) I easily apprehended might bee not a little vsefull for the times; which, if euer, require quickning: Neither is it to no purpose that the world should see in what stile we speake to the Court, not without acceptation. This, and what euer seruice I may bee capable of, are iustly deuoted to your Lordship, whom all good hearts follow with true Honour, as the great Patron of learning, the sincere friend of Religion, and rich purchaser of Truth. The God of Heauen adde to the number of such Peeres, and to the measure of your Lo: graces and happinesse.

closer.signed: Your Honours in all humble and faithfull obseruance, IOS: HALL.
